• STAT_PPID
  • STAT_TTY
  • get_process_mapping
   1 import os
   2 import re
   3 
   4 from ._default import Process
   5 
   6 
   7 STAT_PPID = 3
   8 STAT_TTY = 6
   9 
  10 
  11 def get_process_mapping():
  12     """Try to look up the process tree via the /proc interface.
  13     """
  14     with open('/proc/{0}/stat'.format(os.getpid())) as f:
  15         self_tty = f.read().split()[STAT_TTY]
  16     processes = {}
  17     for pid in os.listdir('/proc'):
  18         if not pid.isdigit():
  19             continue
  20         try:
  21             stat = '/proc/{0}/stat'.format(pid)
  22             cmdline = '/proc/{0}/cmdline'.format(pid)
  23             with open(stat) as fstat, open(cmdline) as fcmdline:
  24                 stat = re.findall(r'\(.+\)|\S+', fstat.read())
  25                 cmd = fcmdline.read().split('\x00')[:-1]
  26             ppid = stat[STAT_PPID]
  27             tty = stat[STAT_TTY]
  28             if tty == self_tty:
  29                 processes[pid] = Process(
  30                     args=tuple(cmd), pid=pid, ppid=ppid,
  31                 )
  32         except IOError:
  33             # Process has disappeared - just ignore it.
  34             continue
  35     return processes
